Code

    table,
    th,

        border: 1px solid black;
        border-collapse: collapse;

        height: 20px;
        text-align: left;
    }
</style>

    <tr>
        <th></th>
        <th colspan="2"></th>

        <td></td>
        <td></td>
    </tr>

</table>

SAP FICO Tables are used to store the data when you enter some data in a screen. If you are working on Cost Center Accounting tables, then which of the following statements about these tables in this scenario are correct:

Statements

  1. Table CSKS represents the Cost center master data
  2. Table CRCO represents the Cost center texts
  3. Table COBK represents the document header
  4. Table COSP represents the Cost totals for external postings

SAP FICO Tables are used to store the data when you enter some data in a screen. If you are working on SAP FI G/L Tables, then which of the following tables represent the SAP Accounting Document header?

SAP FICO Tables are used to store the data when you enter some data in a screen. Which of the following statements about the tables from Enterprise Structure are correct:

Statements

  1. Table TCURR represents the SAP currency-codes
  2. Table T009 represents the SAP Fiscal year variants
  3. Table T004 represents the SAP Chart of Accounts (COA)
  4. Table T001B represents the SAP Permitted posting periods

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. CQL provides the facility of using Collection data types in Cassandra. Assume that you have created a table named owners (id (uuid), LastName (text), FirstName (text)).

id         LastName         FirstName    
1 sam Steven
2 Ergodium sushant
3 Orton Samuel
4 Samuel Badree
5 Smith Patel

What is the output of the following query:

SELECT * FROM owners WHERE firstname LIKE 'S%'
AND LastName LIKE 'S%'
ALLOW FILTERING;

Options

  1. id LastName FirstName
    1 sam Steven
    5 Orton Samuel
    6 Smith Patel
    7 Samuel Badree
  2. id LastName FirstName
    1 sam Steven
  3. id LastName FirstName
    5 Orton Samuel
    6 Smith Patel
    7 Samuel Badree

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra provides CQL shell for executing CQL commands interactively. CQL stores data in tables which are located in keyspaces. Assume that you have created the following table named flag and a keyspace named region.

Country name flag
Belgium Ben 1
Uruguay Alice 3
Spain Bob 4
Sri Lanka Anita 2
Saudi Arabia John 3

Predict the output of the following query:

CREATE CUSTOM INDEX  fn_prefix ON region (Country)
USING 'org.apache.cassandra.index.sasi.SASIIndex';

SELECT count(name) FROM region.flag WHERE Country LIKE '%u%' ALLOW FILTERING;

Options

1. 

system.count(name)
3

2.

system.count(name)
2

3.

region.count(name)
2

4.

region.count(name)
3

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra provides CQL shell for executing CQL commands interactively. CQL stores data in tables which are located in keyspaces. Assume that you have created the following table named cyclist and a keyspace named cycling.

id race_score firstname lastname rank
4 26 Alice Smith 5
2 34 Bob Jones 3
7 49 Mike White 1
8 47 Lisa Davis 2
1 31 Paul Miller 4

Predict the output of the following query:

SELECT sum(race_score) FROM cycling.cyclist;

Options

1. 

race_score
187

2.

sum(race_score)
187

3.

system.sum(sum_score)
187

4.

cycling.sum(sum_score)
187

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra provides a CQL shell for executing CQL commands interactively. CQL stores data in tables that are located in keyspaces. Assume that you have created the following table named playlists and the keyspace named songs.

id song_order album artist song_id title
62c3609271 4 No One Rides Fu Manchu 7db1a49083 Ojo Rojo
62c3609272 3 Roll Away Back Door Slam 2b09185b84 Outside Woman Blues
62c3609273 2 Shower Fu Manchu 8a17261885 Moving in Stereo
62c3609274 1 Beautiful Fu Manchu a3e6f8f886 La Grange

First, you want to change the album name to "Last Ride" where song_id is "8a17261885" and "a3e6f8f886". Secondly, you want to add a column "event" of "list" collection type. Lastly insert a value into the events list as 'Criterium du Dauphine','Tour de Suisse' where song_order is 4.

Which of the following commands can be used to implement the given scenario?

Options

1.

> UPDATE songs.playlists SET album = 'Last Ride' WHERE song_id IN (8a17261885, a3e6f8f886);
> ALTER TABLE songs.playlists ADD events list<text>;
> UPDATE songs.playlists SET events = {'Criterium du Dauphine','Tour de Suisse'} where song_order=4;

 2.

> UPDATE playlists SET album = 'Last Ride' WHERE id IN {8a17261885, a3e6f8f886};
> ALTER TABLE playlists ADD events list<text>;
> UPDATE playlists SET events = ['Criterium du Dauphine','Tour de Suisse'] where song_order=4;

3.

> UPDATE songs.playlists SET album = 'Last Ride' WHERE id IN {8a17261885, a3e6f8f886};
> ALTER TABLE songs.playlists ADD events list;
> UPDATE playlists SET events = {'Criterium du Dauphine','Tour de Suisse'} where song_order=4;

4.

> UPDATE playlists SET album = 'Last Ride' WHERE song_id IN (8a17261885, a3e6f8f886);
> ALTER TABLE songs.playlists ADD events list<text>;
> UPDATE songs.playlists SET events = ['Criterium du Dauphine','Tour de Suisse'] where song_order=4;

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra provides a CQL shell for executing CQL commands interactively. CQL stores data in tables which are located in keyspaces. Assume that you have created the following table named playlists.

id song_order album artist song_id title
62c3609271 4 No One Rides Fu Manchu 7db1a49083 Ojo Rojo
62c3609272 3 Roll Away Back Door Slam 2b09185b84 Outside Woman Blues
62c3609273 2 Shower Fu Manchu 8a17261885 Moving in Stereo
62c3609274 1 Beautiful Fu Manchu a3e6f8f886 La Grange

Now, you have created an index on playlist artist for fast accesing of the data inside the tables by writing the following command on Cassandra shell: 

CREATE INDEX ON playlists(artist);

Predict the output of the following query:

SELECT album, title 
FROM playlists 
WHERE artist = 'Fu Manchu';

Options

1.

album title
Shower Moving in Stereo
No One Rides Ojo Rojo

2.

album title
Shower Moving in Stereo
Beautiful La Grange 

3.

album title
Roll Away Outside Woman Blues
Beautiful La Grange

4.

album title
Shower Moving in Stereo
Roll Away Outside Woman Blues

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra provides a CQL shell for executing CQL commands interactively. CQL stores data in tables which are located in keyspaces. Assume that you have created the following table named student and a keyspace named university.

id     name       grade_point      
1 Ben 8.8
2 Alice 6.7
3 Bob 7.03
4 Anita 9.68
5 John 6.4

Predict the output of the following query:

SELECT MAX(grade_point),name FROM university.student

Options

1.

name system.max(grade_point)
Ben 8.8

2.

name max(grade_point)
Anita 9.68

3.

name system.max(grade_point)
Anita 9.68

4.

name max(grade_point)
Ben 8.8

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra provides a CQL shell for executing CQL commands interactively. CQL stores data in tables that are located in keyspaces. Assume that you have created the following table named cycling and a keyspace named cyclist_name. You have inserted 150000 rows into the table cyclist_name

CREATE TABLE cycling.cyclist_name( 
   id UUID PRIMARY KEY, 
   lastname text,
   firstname text
);

Predict the output of the following query:

SELECT lastname 
FROM cycling.cyclist_name 
LIMIT 50000;

a.option: Cassandra will return 50000 rows in any order.
Cassandra will only return the  middle 50000 rows.
Cassandra will only return the last 50000 rows.
Cassandra will only returns the first 50000 rows.

q: Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. CQL provides the facility of using Collection data types in Cassandra. You want to delete data from the table "office". Which of the following command should we use to perform the specified task?

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. CQL provides the facility of using Collection data types in Cassandra. Which of the following is the correct command to insert data into the elements in a list?

Options

1.

INSERT INTO data[name, email] VALUES ('ramu', {'abc@gmail.com','cba@yahoo.com'})

2.

INSERT INTO data[name, email] VALUES ('ramu', {['abc@gmail.com','cba@yahoo.com']})

3.

INSERT INTO data(name, email) VALUES ('ramu', {['abc@gmail.com','cba@yahoo.com']})

4.

INSERT INTO data(name, email) VALUES ('ramu', ['abc@gmail.com','cba@yahoo.com'])

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. CQL provides the facility of using Collection data types in Cassandra. Which of  the following is the correct command to update the list data type in a table called mytable?

Options

1.

UPDATE mytable
SET email : email like 'xyz@tutorialspoint.com'
where name : 'ramu';

2.

UPDATE mytable
SET email = email like 'xyz@tutorialspoint.com'
where name = 'ramu';

3.

UPDATE mytable
SET email : email +['xyz@tutorialspoint.com']
where name : 'ramu';

4.

UPDATE mytable
SET email = email +['xyz@tutorialspoint.com']
where name = 'ramu';

You have used the table to display the names and countries in which these banks are established. You have written the code as given alongside. What is odd and even used for in the code-snippet?

Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<style>
table, td {
 border: 1px solid grey;
 border-collapse: collapse;
 padding: 5px;
}
</style>
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>
<body>

<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="customersCtrl"> 
<table>
 <tr ng-repeat="x in names">
 <td ng-if="$odd" style="background-color:#f1f1f1">
 {{ x.Name }}</td>
 <td ng-if="$even">
 {{ x.Name }}</td>
 <td ng-if="$odd" style="background-color:#f1f1f1">
 {{ x.Country }}</td>
 <td ng-if="$even">
 {{ x.Country }}</td>
 </tr>
</table>
</div>
<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('customersCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
 $http.get("customers.php")
 .then(function (response) {$scope.names = response.data.records;});
});
</script>
</body>
</html>

a.option: Here the $odd and $even are used for alternate names of the banks.
Here $odd and $even are used to alternate between the white and grey colors for displaying 2 colors alternatively in the rows.
Here $odd and $even are used to alternate between the white and grey colors for displaying different colors in the rows.

q:
You have designed a table to display the name and countries of a list of people. For designing the table you have used the CSS properties given alongside. What does the border-collapse property perform?

Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<style>
table, th , td {
 border: 1px solid grey;
 border-collapse: collapse;
 padding: 5px;
}
table tr:nth-child(odd) {
 background-color: #f1f1f1;
}
table tr:nth-child(even) {
 background-color: #ffffff;
}
</style>
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular.min.js"></script>
</html>

a.option: The border-collapse property sets whether table borders should show as single border or be separated as in standard HTML.
The border-collapse property sets whether table borders should collapse into a single border or be separated as in standard HTML.
The border-collapse property sets whether table should segregate the elements stored inside the table or not.
The border-collapse property sets whether table borders should collapse into a single border or be separated as in standard JavaScript.
